settings.code:
Parrot's Beak

The Parrot's Beak (Gmelina philippensis) is a spiny, tropical bonsai tree that produces yellow flowers that resemble a parrot's beak. The tree is native to the Philippines, India, and Southeast Asia, and has shiny green foliage that can be round, oval, or look like English ivy.

Harland Boxwood

Buxus harlandii aka Harland Boxwood, Chinese Boxwood, Tai Boxwood. These boxwoods are all about their insanely furrowed bark and beautiful small emerald leaves. They can be indoor bonsai but will thrive if put outdoors in the summer and consistently well watered.

Big Jade

Our classic Dwarf Jade bonsai material from our beginner workshops, but with years of further development at the bonsai nursery. These succulents can't get enough water & sunlight. They're also extremely difficult to kill.

JUNIPER

Introducing the iconic tree featured in every Karate Kid movie—the Procumbens Nana Juniper. With green needle foliage and flaky bark that can be removed to reveal it’s distinctive deadwood, the juniper's branches can be twisted to mimic the effects of nature and time. Our first outdoor tree, these require as much sunlight as possible as well as a winter dormancy.
